content:
ScrollBar Class

Definition

Implements the basic functionality of a scroll bar control.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("Scroll")]
[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("Value")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public abstract class ScrollBar : System.Windows.Forms.Control

Remarks

You typically do not inherit directly from the ScrollBar class. To create your own scroll bar class, inherit from the VScrollBar or HScrollBar class.

Note

The scroll box is sometimes referred to as the scroll thumb.

To adjust the value range of the scroll bar control, set the Minimum and Maximum properties. To adjust the distance the scroll box moves, set the SmallChange and LargeChange properties. To adjust the starting point of the scroll box, set the Value property when the control is initially displayed.

User interface guidelines suggest that the SmallChange and LargeChange properties are set relative to the size of the view that the user sees, not to the total size including the unseen part. For example, if you have a picture box with scroll bars displaying a large image, the SmallChange and LargeChange properties should be set relative to the size of the picture box, not to the size of the image.

Constructors

ScrollBar()

Initializes a new instance of the ScrollBar class.

public ScrollBar ();

Remarks

By default, the TabStop property is set to false when a new instance of a ScrollBar is created.

Properties

AutoSize

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ScrollBar is automatically resized to fit its contents.

public override bool AutoSize { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the ScrollBar should be automatically resized to fit its contents; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Setting the AutoSize property has no effect on the appearance of the control.

BackColor

Gets or sets the background color for the control.

public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the background color of the control. The default is the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultBackColor* property.

BackgroundImage

Gets or sets the background image displayed in the control.

public override System.Drawing.Image BackgroundImage { get; set; }
Value
Image

An Image that represents the image to display in the background of the control.

BackgroundImageLayout

Gets or sets the background image layout as defined in the ImageLayout enumeration.

public override System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout BackgroundImageLayout { get; set; }
Value
ImageLayout

One of the values of ImageLayout (Center , None, Stretch, Tile, or Zoom). Tile is the default value.

CreateParams

Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams CreateParams { get; }
Value
CreateParams

A CreateParams that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.

DefaultImeMode

Gets the default Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode DefaultImeMode { get; }
Value
ImeMode

One of the ImeMode values.

Remarks

As implemented in the ScrollBar class, this property always returns the System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode value.

DefaultMargin

Gets the default distance between the ScrollBar control edges and its contents.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.Padding DefaultMargin { get; }
Value
Padding

Padding in all cases.

Font

Gets or sets the font of the text displayed by the control.

public override System.Drawing.Font Font { get; set; }
Value
Font

The Font to apply to the text displayed by the control. The default is the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultFont* property.

ForeColor

Gets or sets the foreground color of the scroll bar control.

public override System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

A Color that represents the foreground color for this scroll bar control. The default is the foreground color of the parent control.

Remarks

This property can only be changed programmatically; it is not visible in the Properties window.

ImeMode

Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.

public System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode ImeMode { get; set; }
Value
ImeMode

One of the ImeMode values.

LargeChange

Gets or sets a value to be added to or subtracted from the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Value* property when the scroll box is moved a large distance.

public int LargeChange { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A numeric value. The default value is 10.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The assigned value is less than 0.

Remarks

When the user clicks in the scroll bar track on either side of the scroll box, the Value property changes according to the value set in the LargeChange property.

Note

You can handle key press events so that when the user presses the PAGE UP or PAGE DOWN key the scroll box moves.

User interface guidelines suggest that the SmallChange and LargeChange properties are set relative to the size of the view that the user sees, not to the total size including the unseen part. For example, if you have a picture box with scroll bars displaying a large image, the SmallChange and LargeChange properties should be set relative to the size of the picture box, not to the size of the image.

Maximum

Gets or sets the upper limit of values of the scrollable range.

public int Maximum { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A numeric value. The default value is 100.

Remarks

You might consider adjusting the Maximum property dynamically to match the size of the scroll bar's parent in proportion to pixel size or to the number of rows or lines displayed.

The maximum value can only be reached programmatically. The value of a scroll bar cannot reach its maximum value through user interaction at run time. The maximum value that can be reached through user interaction is equal to 1 plus the Maximum property value minus the LargeChange property value. If necessary, you can set the Maximum property to the size of the object -1 to account for the term of 1.

Minimum

Gets or sets the lower limit of values of the scrollable range.

public int Minimum { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A numeric value. The default value is 0.

SmallChange

Gets or sets the value to be added to or subtracted from the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Value* property when the scroll box is moved a small distance.

public int SmallChange { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A numeric value. The default value is 1.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The assigned value is less than 0.

Remarks

When the user presses one of the arrow keys or clicks one of the scroll bar buttons, the Value property changes according to the value set in the SmallChange property.

User interface guidelines suggest that the SmallChange and LargeChange properties are set relative to the size of the view that the user sees, not to the total size including the unseen part. For example, if you have a picture box with scroll bars displaying a large image, the SmallChange and LargeChange properties should be set relative to the size of the picture box, not to the size of the image.

TabStop

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to the ScrollBar control by using the TAB key.

public bool TabStop { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the user can give the focus to the control by using the TAB key; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

When the user presses the TAB key, the input focus is set to the next control in the tab order. Controls with the TabStop property value of false are not included in the collection of controls in the tab order. You can manipulate the tab order by setting the control's TabIndex property value.

Text

Gets or sets the text associated with this control.

public override string Text { get; set; }
Value
String

The text associated with this control.

Value

Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll box on the scroll bar control.

public int Value { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A numeric value that is within the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Minimum* and stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Maximum* range. The default value is 0.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The assigned value is less than the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Minimum* property value.

-or-

The assigned value is greater than the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Maximum* property value.

Methods

GetScaledBounds(Rectangle,SizeF,BoundsSpecified)

Returns the bounds to use when the ScrollBar is scaled by a specified amount.

protected override System.Drawing.Rectangle GetScaledBounds (System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds, System.Drawing.SizeF factor, System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified specified);
bounds
Rectangle

A Rectangle that specifies the initial bounds.

factor
SizeF

A SizeF that indicates the amount the current bounds should be increased by.

specified
BoundsSpecified

A bitwise combination of the BoundsSpecified values that indicate the how to define the control's size and position returned by GetScaledBounds.

Returns
Rectangle

A Rectangle specifying the scaled bounds.

Remarks

This is a helper method that used by the ScaleControl method to return the bounds that the control should be scaled by. You may override this method if you wish to reuse ScaleControl scaling logic, but you need to supply your own bounds.

OnEnabledChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the EnabledChanged event.

protected override void OnEnabledChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

OnHandleCreated(EventArgs)

Raises the HandleCreated event.

protected override void OnHandleCreated (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

OnMouseWheel(MouseEventArgs)

Raises the MouseWheel event

protected override void OnMouseWheel (System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs e);
e
MouseEventArgs

A MouseEventArgs

Remarks

The ScrollBar control will convert mouse wheel movements to scrolling when the ScrollBar is in focus.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see NIB: Raising an Event.

The OnMouseWheel method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnScroll(ScrollEventArgs)

Raises the Scroll event.

protected virtual void OnScroll (System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs se);
se
ScrollEventArgs

A ScrollEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see NIB: Raising an Event.

The OnScroll method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnValueChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the ValueChanged event.

protected virtual void OnValueChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see NIB: Raising an Event.

The OnValueChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

ToString()

Returns a string that represents the ScrollBar control.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that represents the current ScrollBar.

Remarks

The ToString method returns a string that includes the type and the values for the MinimumMinimum, and Value properties.

UpdateScrollInfo()

Updates the ScrollBar control.

protected void UpdateScrollInfo ();

Remarks

The UpdateScrollInfo method redraws the ScrollBar by using the values of the Minimum, Maximum, LargeChange, and Value properties.

WndProc(Message)

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc* method.

protected override void WndProc (ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m);
m
Message

A Windows Message object.

Events

AutoSizeChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.AutoSize* property changes.

public event EventHandler AutoSizeChanged;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

BackColorChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.BackColor* property changes.

public event EventHandler BackColorChanged;

BackgroundImageChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.BackgroundImage* property changes.

public event EventHandler BackgroundImageChanged;

BackgroundImageLayoutChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.BackgroundImageLayout* property changes.

public event EventHandler BackgroundImageLayoutChanged;

Click

Occurs when the control is clicked if the ControlStyles bit flag is set to true in a derived class.

public event EventHandler Click;

Remarks

The ScrollBar control sets the ControlStyles bit flag to false, so the ScrollBar will not raise the Click event.

DoubleClick

Occurs when the ScrollBar control is double-clicked.

public event EventHandler DoubleClick;

Remarks

The ScrollBar control sets the ControlStyles bit flag to false, so the ScrollBar will not raise the DoubleClick event.

FontChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Font* property changes.

public event EventHandler FontChanged;

ForeColorChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.ForeColor* property changes.

public event EventHandler ForeColorChanged;

ImeModeChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.ImeMode* property changes.

public event EventHandler ImeModeChanged;

MouseClick

Occurs when the user clicks the ScrollBar control with the mouse.

public event System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventHandler MouseClick;

Remarks

The ScrollBar control does not raise the MouseClick event.

MouseDoubleClick

Occurs when the user double-clicks the ScrollBar control with the mouse.

public event System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventHandler MouseDoubleClick;

Remarks

The ScrollBar control does not raise the MouseDoubleClick event.

MouseDown

Occurs when the mouse pointer is over the control and the user presses a mouse button.

public event System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventHandler MouseDown;

Remarks

The ScrollBar control does not raise the MouseDown event.

MouseMove

Occurs when the user moves the mouse pointer over the control.

public event System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventHandler MouseMove;

MouseUp

Occurs when the user moves the mouse pointer over the control and releases a mouse button.

public event System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventHandler MouseUp;

Remarks

The ScrollBar control does not raise the MouseUp event.

Paint

Occurs when the control is redrawn.

public event System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventHandler Paint;

Scroll

Occurs when the scroll box has been moved by either a mouse or keyboard action.

public event System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventHandler Scroll;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

TextChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Text* property changes.

public event EventHandler TextChanged;

ValueChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Value* property is changed, either by a Scroll event or programmatically.

public event EventHandler ValueChanged;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see NIB: Consuming Events.
